rows.title: Your child as a 20-year-old
rows.outro_text: It is important to involve both men and women in raising a child.

rows.title: Stages of child development
rows.intro_text: We are going to explore the basic developmental needs and behaviors of children 0-17 years.

rows.title: When we do not pay attention
rows.outro_text: Just like adults, children like attention. When you do not give children enough attention, they will behave and act in a way that draws your attention. You must try to pay attention to your children and be interested in the things they are doing.

rows.title: Too much control
rows.outro_text: It is good practice for parents to be involved in their children’s play but this should be done respectfully with the full consent of the child. Play should meet the needs of the child and not the parents; thus play the child’s way and not the parent’s way.

rows.title: Interactive play with children
rows.intro_text: Children must have uninterrupted time to play in order to learn and gain life skills. Here are 2 scenarios and reflection activities that will help understand and support children’s play:
rows.outro_text: Play promotes every aspect of children’s development – physical, social, emotional and cognitive.

rows.title: Managing difficult behavior
rows.intro_text: Here is a comic that illustrates a mother reinforcing behavior, followed by an activity:
rows.outro_text:
* Humbly, Sarah was trying to get her brother to play with her.
* Instead of the mother encouraging them to enjoy the play together, she made it worse by shouting at her daughter Sarah. This is common in our everyday lives.
* As parents, we tend to favor the young ones at the expense of the older ones.
* The mother needed to resolve the problem between the two siblings instead of referring the issue to their father.
* She needed to help the children to play together happily.

rows.title: Setting limits for our children
rows.intro_text: Here is a comic illustrating a scenario of a parent setting limits for her child, and some questions:
rows.outro_text:
Notice:
* The mother sits with the child at the same level and communicates the limit. It’s a respectful position where both people are ready to listen.
* The limit should be for a specific behaviour to ensure that Sam abides to the limit. A watch is provided so that they can refer to it.
* Just like the mother, we need to appreciate the children when they follow family rules and limits to encourage them to keep following them.

rows.title: Understanding gender stereotypes
rows.intro_text: Let's reflect upon how gender norms can be harmful to both women and men or girls and boys.

rows.title: The violence around me
rows.intro_text: Here are a story and an activity that will help us explore common causes of conflicts and discuss the consequences of violence on parents and children:
rows.outro_text:
To construct healthy non-violent respectful relationships with spouses and/or children fathers/mothers should consistently practice to:
* Listen carefully to the other party
* Be patient and stay calm
* Agree to disagree
* Set realistic rules, communicate them clearly to family, and stick to them
* Allow conversation/dialogue and negotiate

rows.title: Caregiving and fatherhood/motherhood
rows.outro_text: Most traditional roles associated with ‘being a man’ or ‘being a woman’ prescribe a small role for men in caring for their children.Fathers who are more involved enjoy more positive relations with their children.

rows.title: Men, Women and Caregiving
rows.intro_text: In this activity we wil promote reflection and increase awareness about gender differences in terms of care-giving and caring relationships.

rows.title: Throw the Drunk Ball
rows.intro_text:
In this activity we are going to: 
* Learn how excessive drinking affects family relationships 
* Learn how to help partners reduce alcohol consumption and other socially unacceptable practices/ behavior.

rows.title: Marital Relationships and Communication
rows.intro_text:
In this activity we are going to: 
* Learn what constitutes a healthy marriage and sexuality and the importance of healthy communication in a marriage

rows.title: Review
rows.intro_text: Let us review sessions 1-9 and share some of the lessons learned.

rows.title: The Ball of Change
rows.outro_text:
Thank you for your dedication to the program and for seeing

Positive and sensitive interaction with children
rows.intro_text:
In this activity we are going to: 
* Discuss how to positively and sensitively engage with our children to promote respect.

rows.title: Differences between harsh communication and positive, respectful communication
Children’s needs at school
rows.outro_text: Children’s needs at school are many and some of them can be fulfilled without financial input. Children’s school needs vary depending on the level of education. Older children tend to have a wider range of needs and may drop out of school if not supported well by their parents.

rows.title: Practicing skills to encourage children to stay in school
rows.outro_text: It takes more than a good school/teacher to educate children. And it takes more than a good home/parent to raise a respectful child. However, these two have to work together.

rows.title: Act like a Man/Act like a Woman
rows.intro_text:
Here we will:
Identify the differences between the behaviour expected of men and women.
Understand how the gendered rules affect the lives of women and men, girls and boys.

rows.title: Partnership parenting
rows.intro_text:
In this activity, we will:
Get to know the issues in which fathers and mothers tend to have different perspectives regarding child upbringing.
Agree on how to resolve differences in parenting roles for the proper growth of the children.

rows.title: No means No: Need for awareness
rows.intro_text: In this activity, we are going to explore long-term goals for the prevention of sexual abuse and early sex.
rows.outro_text:
* It’s important to communicate and share information with children about their sexuality to enable them to make informed decisions to delay sex and avoid possible abuse situations.
* Discussing and communicating about sexuality is a skill and forms the basis of openness and trust with our children.

rows.title: Openness, Transparency and Communication
rows.intro_text:
Here we will:
* Develop in expressing personal needs and feelings and in listening reflectively and empathetically.

rows.title: The Head of Family
rows.intro_text:
In this activity we are going to: 
* Reinforce our commitment to positive, more equitable, and respectful parenting.

rows.outro_text: Thank you for your participation and openness.
